thread.title: Kentucky guard Hawkins to miss 4 weeks with broken hand
thread.title_full: Kentucky guard Hawkins to miss 4 weeks with broken hand

title: Kentucky guard Hawkins to miss 4 weeks with broken hand
text:
Kentucky reserve guard Dominique Hawkins to miss 4 weeks with broken right hand THE ASSOCIATED PRESS First Posted: October 05, 2015 - 9:00 pmLast Updated: October 05, 2015 - 9:00 pm We also have more stories about: (click the phrases to see a list) 
People: 
Kentucky (443) 

LEXINGTON, Kentucky — Kentucky guard Dominique Hawkins will miss four weeks after breaking his right hand in practice over the weekend. 
The junior will have surgery Tuesday to repair a broken bone in the hand and is expected to return in early November. A defensive specialist who provides energy off the bench, Hawkins has played in 56 career games. 
Coach John Calipari expects the Richmond, Kentucky, native to be in his rotation this season and said Monday he felt bad for Hawkins' injury, adding in a release, "He was so much more confident, so much more skilled. ... Now he's got to get back and stay in shape." 
Kentucky opens the season Nov. 13 against Albany.
